content.question: A particle is moving on the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis and the position of the particle at time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="x of, t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, whose graph is shown above. Which of the following is the best estimate for the speed of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 4 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 1.1: Introducing Calculus - Can Change Occur at an Instant?
